Name: Tove Lo
Description: A Swedish singer and songwriter, she has attracted attention in 2013 with the release of the single« Habits », but this success has made a remix of hip-hop producer Hippie Sabotage for this song, which was called« Stay High ». March 4, 2014 released her debut mini-album, Truth Serum, and the debut studio album Queen of the Clouds September 24, this year. Tove Lo is the author of songs by artists like Icona Pop, Girls Aloud and Cher Lloyd.

Name: Ne-Yo
Description: winner of three Grammy Awards, an American singer, songwriter, producer, actor, philanthropist In 2009, Billboard magazine has put Ne-Yo on the 57th' Artists of the Decade 'in the ranking

Name: Usher
Description: Is an American singer and actor One of the most commercially successful R & B-musicians African American currently sells more than 65 million copies of his albums worldwide, won seven awards 'Grammy', four World Music Awards prize, four awards. American Music Award and nineteen awards Billboard Music Awards. The owner of his own record label uS Records. It takes 21 place in the list of the most successful musicians according to the Billboard, and the second place, losing to Eminem in the list of the most successful musicians of the 2000s. in 2010, Glamour magazine included him in the list of the 50 sexiest men.

Name: Jay Sean
Description: British rapper, who is originally from India, was born in west London, England have released three album Me Against Myself, My Own Way and All or Nothing

Name: Kelly Rowland
Description: American singer and actress Acts style modern rhythm and blues, is the author of the lyrics.

Name: Timbaland
Description: American rapper, music producer, arranger and songwriter, label founder Mosley Music Group, two-time winner of awards 'Grammy'.

Name: Keri Hilson
Description: American singer and songwriter in the style of contemporary R & B, works on labels Zone 4 / Mosley Music Group / Interscope Records is a member association of writers and producers known as The Clutch

Name: Sugababes
Description: Female pop trio from London, which was formed in 1998, the year The group has released 27 singles, six of which became number 1 in the UK and seven albums, two of which also climbed to the top of the British album charts . Three girls album went triple platinum. in 2003, the year they won in the nomination 'Best dance performer', and in 2006, the year were named the UK performers twenty-first century, ahead of artists such as Britney Spears and Madonna. around the world was purchased by more than fourteen million copies Sugababes album.

Name: Shaznay Lewis
Description: British singer, songwriter and actress.

Name: Emma Bunton
Description: British singer, songwriter and television presenter.

Name: Geri Halliwell
Description: British singer, songwriter and children's writer Has achieved fame in the mid-1990s as a member of the female pop group Spice Girls Halliwell made the most successful solo career of all the participating groups was four times nominated for Brit Awards, released four singles have reached number one on the British charts, and total sales of her albums exceed four million copies.

Name: Mutya Buena
Description: British singer, former member of the group« Sugababes ».

Name: Spice Girls
Description: British female pop band formed in London in 1994.

Name: Girls Aloud
Description: British pop group, formed in 2002 during the reality show channel ITV Popstars: The Rivals Consisting of Cheryl Cole, Sarah Harding, Nicola Roberts, Kimberley Walsh and Nadine Coyle Group has released twenty-two singles, five studio albums, two compilations of the best hits and two albums of remixes. All albums Girls Aloud have also been certified platinum in the UK. The group was five times nominated at the BRIT Awards, and in 2009 won in the category 'Best single' for the song «The Promise» .

Name: Melanie C
Description: British singer-songwriter best known as a member of the most popular in the history of the music business girl group« Spice Girls », which appeared under the pseudonym« Sporty Spice »It is also known under the pseudonym« Mel C »or« Melanie. C. »

Name: Tokio Hotel
Description: German synthpop group formed in 2001 in Magdeburg As part: Bill Kaulitz, Tom Kaulitz, Gustav Schäfer, Georg Listing.

Name: Hilary Duff
Description: American actress, singer, entrepreneur, model and producer Born and raised in Houston, Texas, has appeared in several local theater productions and TV commercials in early childhood, Duff became a teen idol after being shot in the channel show Disney Channel 'Lizzie McGuire' in the early 2000s and the film 'Lizzie Maguire' in which she appeared in the eponymous role.

Name: Carly Rae Jepsen
Description: Canadian singer of British Columbia In 2007, she participated in the fifth Canadian Idol season shortly after participating in the Canadian Idol, she signed a contract with record labels Fontana and MapleMusic and 30 September 2008, released their debut album, Tug of War . Three years later, she released a new single titled «Call Me Maybe», the new album Curiosity followed him, was released February 14, 2012. «Call Me Maybe» by far the most successful single of the singer, he achieved 1st place in the Billboard Hot 100 and Canadian Hot 100. peaks Jepsen signed with Interscope. April 14, 2012 the song «Call Me Maybe» topped the UK Singles Chart.

Name: Bonnie McKee
Description: American singer, songwriter, actress. In 2011, named the magazine Rolling Stone 'The best secret weapon'. McKee is co-author of eight number one singles, which were sold in the amount of 25 million copies around the world. It works with pop co-star Katy Perry and co-wrote hits like «California Gurls», «Teenage Dream», «Last Friday Night», «Part of Me», «Wide Awake», «Roar». also Bonnie is a co-author of the song Taio Cruz ' Dynamite », which became the second best selling British song of the artist in the digital era .

Name: Allison Iraheta
Description: American singer, winner of the music contest.« Quinceañera: Mama Quiero Ser Artista », American Idol finalist of the 2009 season of the year released his first album Just Like You in 2009. He lives in Los Angeles

Name: Kelly Clarkson
Description: American singer and actress Clarkson gained fame after participating in a TV show American Idol in 2002 and represented the United States in the competition «World Idol» in 2003, more than 10.5 million copies of her albums were sold in the United States

Name: Ciara
Description: American singer, songwriter, record producer, dancer, actress, model, director of clips Ciara made her debut in the summer of 2004 with the single «Goodies», who got the top of the chart Billboard Hot 100. The self-titled album was released in the United States September 28, 2004, it sales amounted to more than five million worldwide and received numerous awards and nominations.

Name: Sting
Description: British musician, singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, activist, actor and philanthropist leader of the group The Police in 1976-1984 years Since 1984, solo acts.

Name: Keane
Description: British rock band was founded in 1995 under the name «Lotus Eaters» in Battle in 1997 acquired its present name widely known group acquired only in 2003, and the first album was released in 2004. A distinctive feature of the sound. It is atypical for rock music a situation where the main instrument acts not guitar and keyboards.

Name: The Killers
Description: American indie rock band formed in 2002, Brandon Flowers and Dave Keuning The name was taken from a video clip New Order« Crystal », where, under the same name appears fictitious band's music The Killers most clearly shows the influence of groups. New Order, Duran Duran, U2 and Oasis.

Name: OneRepublic
Description: American pop-rock band from Colorado Springs, fame which brought the single« Apologize », which became the US triple platinum and reached the third place in the UK charts 11 November 2007. The remix of the song was included in the album Timbaland «Shock Value» in the debut album OneRepublic «Dreaming Out Loud».

Name: Imagine Dragons
Description: An American indie rock band formed in Las Vegas, Nevada in 2008, became known after the release of their debut studio album Night Visions in September 2012. The American magazine Billboard named them the brightest new stars of 2013 and Rolling Stone magazine named their single «Radioactive» biggest rock hit of the year.

Name: Brian Eno
Description: British musician electronics, music theorist and record producer Perhaps best known as the father of ambient music his career, Brian Eno started as a keyboard player and a specialist in sound effects in the group Roxy Music in the early 1970s.

Name: Radiohead
Description: British rock band from Oxfordshire was formed in 1985, and its structure from that time has not changed Style Radiohead is traditionally defined as alternative rock, although at different stages of the sound varied from Britpop to the art-rock. and electronic music.

Name: Brandon Flowers
Description: . The vocalist, keyboardist and author of the majority of the group The Killers Brandon Flowers texts was born in the town of Henderson, Nev He grew up in a large family with an average income of children From 6 Brandon was the youngest.

Name: Snow Patrol
Description: an alternative rock band with members from Northern Ireland and Scotland Formed in Dundee, currently members of the group live in Glasgow, Belfast and London, the winners of the Ivor Novello Awards Music Awards

Name: Muse
Description: . British rock band formed in 1994 in the town of Teignmouth Group consists of three members: Matthew Bellamy, Christopher Wolstenholme and Dominic Howard.

Name: Norah Jones
Description: an American jazz singer and pianist, author and performer of his own songs, the actress daughter of Ravi Shankar Her half-sister - Anoushka Shankar.

Name: Koop
Description: Swedish electro-jazz duo of Oscar Simonsson and Magnus Zingmarka Despite the 'orchestral' sound, Koop music is completely electronic and is made up of thousands of short samples

Name: Nina Simone
Description: . American singer, pianist, composer, aranzhirovschitsa Practicing jazz tradition, but use very different executable material that combines jazz, soul, pop, gospel and blues, recorded songs with great orchestra.

Name: Anna Ternheim
Description: The Swedish singer, composer and songwriter, performs his songs in English.

Name: Richard Rodgers
Description: American composer who wrote the music for more than 900 songs and 40 Broadway musicals He also composed music for films and television best known for co-written with songwriters Lorenz Hart and Oscar Hammerstein II His music has had a serious impact on. musical culture of the United States.

Name: Antonio Carlos Jobim
Description: Brazilian composer, singer, pianist and guitarist, combining in his work elements of jazz and traditional Brazilian music, in the United States known as Tom Jobim One of the founders of the musical style of bossa nova

Name: Ira Gershwin
Description: American songwriter, brother of the famous composer George Gershwin, in collaboration with his brother created a lot of popular Broadway productions, the most famous of which is the opera 'Porgy and Bess'. After the death of George Gershwin collaborated with composers Harold Arlen, Kurt Weill, Jerome Kern and others.

Name: Thor
Description: Canadian heavy metal band, founded in 1977 by John Mickley Thor, in different years existed under different names.

Name: Sia
Description: Australian singer and songwriter in the style of emotional jazz and pop, as well as an actress first her album was released back in 1997, but only Some People Have Real Problems in 2008 was a success in 2010. And this has received six nominations. ARIA Music Awards and won the award for 'best independent album', 'best pop album' and 'best video'. in 2014, the song 'Chandelier' received four nominations for 'Grammy' in the categories of 'Record of the year', 'song of the year', 'Best solo pop Performance', 'Best music video'.

Name: David Guetta
Description: French DJ and producer Guetta is one of the most popular music producers, collaborating with artists and groups such as Jessie J, The Black Eyed Peas, Rihanna, Akon, Chris Willis, Kelly Rowland, Lil Wayne, Kelis, Madonna , Kid Cudi, Estelle, Pitbull, Fergie, K'naan, will.i.am, LMFAO, Taio Cruz, Flo Rida, apl.de.ap, Snoop Dogg, Sia, Martin Garrix, Lady Gaga and Nicki Minaj.

Name: Eminem
Description: American rapper, music producer, composer and actor addition to his solo career, Marshall is also a member of the group D12 and hip-hop duo Bad Meets Evil, Eminem is one of the best-selling music artists in the world, as well as the best-selling. artist of the 2000s. He was named as one of the greatest musicians of all time by many magazines, including Rolling Stone, who posted Eminem under the 83-th number in the list of the 100 greatest artists. the same magazine declared him King of hip-hop. If the count and studio the work of his group, then Eminem has 10 albums that reached the top spot in the Billboard 200. As a solo artist, Eminem has sold more than 100 million albums around the world.
